website_summaries.verdict: The Motorola Moto G5 Plus is the better budget phone in nearly every way. Get the Huawei Honor 6X only if you really want a dual rear camera.
pros: The Huawei Honor 6X has a dual rear camera, a ton of advanced camera tools and it's way cheap
cons: It runs an older version of Android and sometimes lags when launching or switching apps
Photo quality doesn't live up to the tools

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Moto X
customer_reviews.text: I'm really surprised what a great phone this is for $250. The battery life is the best I have ever seen, barely hitting 40% after a day of frequent use including Bluetooth audio and navigation. The processor is fast, no lag in apps. The fingerprint sensor works great. I really like the EMUI, much better notification system than the standard Android 6. Camera, reception, display - no regrets here either. Also worth mentioning: Unlike my previous Samsung, Motorola and LG phones, you can actually uninstall/remove all bloatware apps that come with the phone. Definitely recommend this thing!
customer_reviews.author: PaulTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It's the best phone I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Had this phone for 2 days and honestly I'm sold. I got it on cyber Monday for only $150.00 and it's the best phone I've ever had. -Battery is good, runs all my apps fine, cameras are amazing. -Also, it's pretty. I love the look of it and the interface. -It has cool features that other phones don't have built-in, like screen recording and selfie enhancing. -The fingerprint scanner on the back makes unlocking your phone easy as heck. -Gives you useful little cues about apps that are taking up RAM or battery. -Awesome customization.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first, hate it now. I don't recommend anyone purchase in his phone.
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this phone in December I loved it. It seem to have plenty of memory and the features works great. I like the phone so much I bought my wife one. But in the last month it keeps locking up. Mainly the camera locks up but occasionally the whole phone will lock up and the only way to resolve it is to repower it. My wife is having the same problems. In its current state I would not recommend this phone. I regret buying it but I will reach out to Honor to see if they have a fix.
customer_reviews.author: M&M82

customer_reviews.title: Huawei will not honor warranty.  Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: AVOID - Broke quickly. Huawei will not honor warranty. Phone broke after 3 months. Microphone dead, speakers barely make sound. Reported to get RMA and warranty repair. Phone came back stating "water damage". This is pure bull. Phone was never near water/humidity. They just use cheap contracting services that apparently don't want to do any work. Use cheap excuses not to do any warranty work.
customer_reviews.author: GOVA

customer_reviews.title: Would never recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Was thrilled in the beginning. Especially with Huawei advertised regularly updated. Have received zero updates in 8 months. Phone is beginning to bow, has become sluggish and glitchy. Contacted customer support about warranty, expressed my concerns, was asked, 'Will that be all?" I asked about warranty and they just hung up on me. Chat support is the same. They do not Honor warranty nor does Huawei provide the regular updates as advertised. I will purchase a reliable brand elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wenner

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this phone.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is not worth the money. It continually ignores calls without letting the caller know someone tried calling. We have had to call tech support multiple times. . Very frustrating. I tried contacting seller through Amazon but we missed our window for return,exchange by a week, even though our problems started before that. Every time this happens, we must call and have tech reset the inside codes, This is very time consuming. Another issue is that the phone won't receive group chats or pictures. I was hoping for an exchange and that this was just a fluke phone but I couldn't make that happen as there is no way to contact the seller, I was stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Screen has washed out look
customer_reviews.text: One week of use and very impressed but also a little let down. Value is top notch but screen is lacking. I'm coming from Samsung note 4 so maybe it's the AMOLED I'm missing. It reminds me of when I did a monitor comparison between a high end Dell monitor with a cheap AOC monitor. The screen has this harsh blue to it. I've fiddled with the color correction and while I can get it to look light, in different lighting conditions or apps it looks washed out. Fantastic value on this phone otherwise and it's kind of a deal breaker for me. Probably done this to a family member.
customer_reviews.author: Customer232323

customer_reviews.title: T-Mobile connectivity challenges.
customer_reviews.text: If it didn't drop calls and send callers straight to v-mail, I'd give it four stars. It really is great value. That said, I'm having issues with T-Mobile and the Huawei Honor 6X on T-Mobile's network. Frequently, my Honor 6X sends callers directly to v-mail. I'm also experiencing frequent dropped calls. My wife has zero connectivity issues with her Nexus 6. I previously used Moto G3, Nokia phones, BLU phones (and even an Amazon Fire phone) without connectivity issues. T-Mobile can't find anything 'wrong' with their service. Other reviewers seem to have experienced similar issues with T-Mobile service (carrier/phone frequency incompatibility). So in my experience, the Honor 6X works inconsistently on T-Mobile's network.
customer_reviews.author: Nate G

customer_reviews.title: Simply AMAZING performance.
customer_reviews.text: I'm simply AMAZED at the quality and functionality of this phone. The few negative things that I found from various sources seem to have been wiorked out (ie: one person complained that there's no flashlight mode. There's a flashlight mode now). Response time is snappy, bright and easy to use screen. Fantastic camera. The fingerprint thing works excellent too and can even distinguish which finger I'm using. I've had everything from iPhones to little cheap starter phones and everything in between and so far this is my favorite (and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg).
customer_reviews.author: Ken E.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for a very very long time, and I'm not very impressed with it. I got it because it was supposed to be very nice for the price it was, and its just okay. It was amazing for the first month or so, but after that it slowed down immensely. It will freeze quite often, and at this point it barely charges. I think its a fine purchase if you have money to waste and aren't planning to use it for very long, but I personally don't think its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaydon B

customer_reviews.title: the built in camera app is really pretty good and has quite a few features
customer_reviews.text: No, it's not an Iphone X but for the price I can buy 6-7 to use as a spares. the built in camera app is really pretty good and has quite a few features: scanning, HDR, Good food (makes food look "better"), slow motion, object tracking, say "cheese" to take a picture, etc. The battery life is pretty epic as well. I unplugged fro the charger 5 hours ago and I'm currently at 93%. I can go two days easily although I'm not a massive user.
customer_reviews.author: D. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if you have T-Mobile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for both my parents last year (November 2017). Everything worked fine until about the summer of 2018, where there were numerous times I tried to call my parents, only to be directly forwarded to their voicemail. They indicated that they had no missed call notification. I thought it was attributed to the Wifi+ and APN settings, but still couldn't solve this issue. I searched the forums and noticed this is a common occurrence for the Honor 6x. I have the Honor 8, but haven't encountered this issue for my phone. It seems problem is very common for T-Mobile customers.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE

customer_reviews.title: Proven Winner
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Believe the positive reviews. NOTE: It DOES takes a few GB (yes, that's gigabytes) to get EMUI updated (this can be done over your wifi), but it's so worth it. Amazing amazing. Very happy. Would buy again. Have heard this several times: "Is that the new iPhone?" Looks great, incredible price, great camera(s), longest battery ever. Read the reviews on the internet- this thing is a proven winner. [PS - I also bought the EasyAcc soft TPU case for the Honor6x, which is clear, and shows off the gold backing / white front] [PSS - Super bright screen, I also recommend a 'black out' privacy screen-protector]
customer_reviews.author: JinJiDuLi

customer_reviews.title: Caveat emptor - crapware!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this phone, but I guess the saying "you get what you pay for" is true. This a bloatware riddled monstrosity that has degenerated into frustratingly slow, unresponsive piece of garbage in the span of 3 short months. It's dropping calls, not sending texts or delaying them to the point of uselessness, and constantly needs to either be rebooted or have apps manually and forcefully closed to allow any sort of normal use. I am by no means a power user with multiple apps running at any time either; this thing is just dog slow. Save your money for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Emmer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this phone it's junk!
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked fine at first and I don't have a lot of apps on it maybe half the memory is used up, but in the last 3-4months this phone is getting worse half of the time it takes forever for it to decide if it wants to work it's very annoying the other night I wanted to take some pictures and couldn't get the camera to work and then got a pop up that the phone wasn't responding? The hell you say how can that happen, so don't waste your money it's to late for me oh and I have had this since Jan 11 2018!
customer_reviews.author: T. S. KOENIG

customer_reviews.title: NO RECEPTION WITH T-MOBILE, NO 4G DATA
customer_reviews.text: This phone has very weak reception with T-Mobile, which I can hardly make a clear phone call; and it can hardly get 3G or 4G data. When I insert the same SIM card to another phone, it gets strong reception. I asked the seller for this question, he just gave me a HuaWei customer service number and let me to call them. When I called them, they were like knowing nothing. Do NOT waste your money on this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality phone for under $200
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic phone. It has a beautiful screen, premium look and feel with a great simple design and it has Android 7.0. Most of the bloatware can be uninstalled which is a breath of fresh air and the user interface is good. The only thing to critique is that the audio is not great, the one speaker is lackluster, even with headphones the audio sounds weak. If you are looking for a phone for music you might want to look elsewhere. Other than that it's a great phone for under $200.
customer_reviews.author: fry

customer_reviews.title: Well made and the performance is good.  Fairly stock Android running on top of EMUI.  This was a gift for my daughter.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and the performance is good. Fairly stock Android running on top of EMUI. This was a gift for my daughter. The UI is very good and with those used to 100% stock Android there's a little learning curve. Or you can use Google Launcher. Build Quality is good. Performance is Good. Display and Battery life a also very good. The phone needs a clear case and screen protector. These are a must. It's not a fragile phone but wise to protect your investment with a screen protector. If you've used iOS and Android you'll find the Huawei Honor 6 a nice and budget friendly device.
customer_reviews.author: Jim_USATop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone! We have always used phones that were styled like Samsung (Volume rocker and Power button on opposite sides). This phone has both of those buttons on one side. It took awhile to get use to, but my husband says he prefers it set up like this. The metal body of the phone is not only useful for protection but looks great too. Fingerprint scanner works amazingly well and is quick to respond. The only negative thing we can find with this phone is a slight connection delay when you answer a call. It takes about two seconds before the person on the other side can hear you.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Ethridge

customer_reviews.title: great for tethering on cricket wireless
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, no issue, it allows me to internet tethering without having to pay ( I use cricket wireless). I was not able to tether using the honor 5x, so this great, no root needed. Get a case and tempered glass protector as this phone is may be forgiving to being dropped.
customer_reviews.author: azb

customer_reviews.title: I did not expect this phone to last as long as it has
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, but I certainly did not expect the quality I got for the price. I've used this phone heavily for the past 7 months, and it's still going strong. I broke my iPhone 7, and needed a "temporary" phone until my renewal was up. Figured this would be a sufficient enough replacement for a few months. I really did not expect a phone in this price range to last more than 6 months, and see no point in upgrading until this one dies. To be honest, when this one eventually does get replaced I'll probably get another Huawei device.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: The phone is good but there's a few things that bug me about ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone is good but there's a few things that bug me about it. I don't know if it's the YouTube app but when I back out of a YouTube video the screen flickers until you hit the home button it will eventually stop. Second the Bluetooth has problems as well as the wifi when they are both on. The Bluetooth pauses alot and the WiFi goes really slow but that's only when they are both on other then that this phone is decent I bought two of them and they both do the same things that I find annoying. I'll be returning these very soon!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer, hampered by software.
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, but I've noticed a lot of lag on this phone. Clearly this is a second tier phone. For the price though, you shouldn't expect a Samsung or iPhone type experience. The one thing that is aggravating though is that it feels like it is the miui interface and bloatware that are making this phone perform below what it is capable of. Overall though, I'm still satisfied with this phone for the price. It is still a solid performing phone that doesn't unexpectedly crash. Additionally, the battery life is very good on this phone and I've never had trouble making it through a day regardless of heavy usage.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan - Avid Handyman

customer_reviews.title: This phone is great. Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This phone is great. Works as expected. For all the people that gave bad review remember you only paid 249.00 THIS IS NOT A FLAGSHIP PHONE!. The phone runs smooth no lag, speaker is average, camera is good and screen is pretty good to. Best feature on phone is battery life I would recommend to anyone looking for a great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Capocci

customer_reviews.title: The only good thing about this phone is the long battery life
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about this phone is the long battery life. The software that it runs on is very glitchy. Apps and camera froze constantly, and the worst part was that at least on T-Mobile, calls would go straight to voicemail 50% of the times, and forget about getting text messages on time. The volume on the speakers, even when plugging in external speakers or headphones is extremely low. I bought two of these and we only used them for 3 full months. Replaced them with a LG V30 and all reception problems went away. Maybe it has to do with not being a T-Mobile phone, though it's unlocked and GSM.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Phone!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The phone is excellent, so far I'm very happy with my purchase. My recommendation: update asap to emui 5.0 (2.35 Gb more o less) because with the software version installed (emui4.0) the avg free ram is about 1.4-1.5 Gb, after updating to emui 5.0 the avg free ram on the phone is 2.0 - 2.1 Gb a really nice improvement; also huawei confirmed the update to oreo by late january (search xda for the info) that's the only thing holding me to install a custom recovery and rooting the phone (I'm a root freak with my phones)
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. Very high quality, excellent performance, solid network connectivity and the Emotion UI is really full-featured and easy to use. I would recommend this phone to anyone. I was concerned about security issues since where I work we have extremely tight network security and constant Wi-Fi monitoring for any connections going overseas. Several phones employees have bought off eBay have been banned from using our employer's Wi-Fi because of this. However, this phone has never once popped up with security warnings. I'm quickly becoming a big Huawei fan and am eyeing the Honor 7x or Mate 10 as an upgrade for my wife's Xperia.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget choice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend to replace her old one plus. The quality of the phone is great for the price. She has noticed that some apps simply aren't available to her despite having an up-to-date OS and access to the play store. She suspects this is due to Chinese origin but I can't say one way or the other. We'll likely go with a different manufacturer in the future as a "just in case" precaution, but the phone has worked really well for the last year or so.
customer_reviews.author: __barnett

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: I bought my honor 6x during a black Friday sale where it had been knocked down to 150 dollars. For the money, This phone cannot be beat in value. A dual camera, with a fingerprint scanner and good build quality makes this a fantastic buy. The UI after the update out of the box is very appealing and usable. Operations are buttery smooth and my battery doesn't even go down 10% after am hour of heavy use. Buy this phone if you are a baller on a budget like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for buck. Very impressed with the Huawei Honor 6X.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone as a "cheap" replacement for my iphone 6S and wasn't expecting much to be honest. Wow was I wrong. This phone is amazing and has been exceeding my expectations since day 1. Excellent camera, processing speed, battery life, connectivity, aesthetics, and features. Since the switch I now get service in places my iphone never worked and I come home from work with 70% battery left instead of having to charge my phone by lunch. I recommend this phone for anyone looking for a great performance phone at an incredible price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This phone is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This phone is horrible!!!!! We bought 5 before Christmas. 1/5 works properly. The others have many glitches. My fingerprint scanner stopped working after 3 weeks. You touch something on your screen and it'll bring up something completely different. The phone freezes all the time, and the screen will just go black. I do not recommend this phone. I saw so many great ratings and that's why I got it. I was completely disappointed in my entire family is as well. The phone that does work is because the person never uses social media. If you're a person who likes to get on social media I do not recommend this phone at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best phone you never heard of!
customer_reviews.text: How is this phone so cheap? It is as good as or better than phones costing hundreds more! No payments, no fees, just take your sim card out of your old phone and put it in the new phone and BANG! It is ready to use! No need to go to your retail store or let them know anything. You have the right to buy your phone anywhere. There is no need to spend a fortune on a phone anymore. This does everything the same. If you are making monthly payments on a cell phone you are crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Steve & Kelly Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: So far great Android smartphone
customer_reviews.text: So far great Android smartphone. I don’t care if the USB is not a USB-C, as long as I can charge it and communicate with the device. The screen size is great, same exact size as my iPhone 6Plus. The fingerprint sensor is extremely fast, much faster than my iPhone. I haven’t yet assessed other features, like the battery charge, speed of apps, etc. But for the price, it’s a very good option. Only drawback is the older version of Android, thus 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Abtine Najand

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Latest Huawei Flavored Android OS, Amazing Battery Life. Will longer stick to mainstream phones. Would Buy Again.
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this phone, the fingerprint scanner is quick, the video playback is really crisp, and the processing is very fast. The battery will last me 2 days sometimes with lots of use.. Taking battery life out of your concerns when going on long day trips or traveling. The Huawei flavor of Android is nice and clean.. updated to the latest version of android, while many pricier phones are still working on older versions.. Split screen is great, as I can watch youtube, while surfing facebook or the internet... I use this now more than my tablet great buy !
customer_reviews.author: Bradley W Taylor

customer_reviews.title: There are many cool features on this phone
customer_reviews.text: There are many cool features on this phone, like fingerprint unlock, however, it is constantly freezing and the photo app is always freezing when i first open it, which really makes taking photos difficult. Given that we use our phones as cameras now, you would think that this would not happen. I am giving it two stars because of the freezing issue with the camera app and other apps upon opening.
customer_reviews.author: Hiba Agha

customer_reviews.title: It's under priced.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is, this phone has functioned the same way since DAY 1 & it's been almost 3 years. I have to mention it because, I have owned phones that have not last me half of that. No complaints. If you're bummed that its not an iPhone (..like why?), buy a nice cover. No one will notice the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jiamei Resident

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone, but........
customer_reviews.text: I have had a problem the whole time I've had this phone with TMobile! I don't receive calls at all, or texts for an hour or more. I've complained to Tmobile and they have just told me it's not one of the phones they support (despite listings saying the phone is fully compatible with Tmobile!). Though I have no problem calling out or sending texts to others, I've had consistent difficulty with the phone only showing records of receiving calls from others, regardless of their carrier, and I only receive texts long after they have texted me. Voicemails also are delayed by 12 or more hours.
customer_reviews.author: James E Newton

customer_reviews.title: Best part about this phone was the finger print sensor
customer_reviews.text: Best part about this phone was the finger print sensor. It's super fast and accurate. The interface was very glitchy. I wasn't able to scroll back through text conversations; when I would try, it would just automatically go back to the end of the thread. Returned the phone and got the moto g5 plus instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sameer Hasan

customer_reviews.title: Was OK until a year ago
customer_reviews.text: Great build for a phone, but I've a problem with this one starting a year ago. Not sure if it is carrier related, but people cant call the phone, and I have to turn off the wireless/data and turn it back on before calls come through again, weird. 3/5. Did a search online, and did the factory reset, re-seating the sim card, etc all already, and nothing seems to fix it permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Hai Time

customer_reviews.title: Same as any $1000 phone out there
customer_reviews.text: I've had my phone for a month now and so far I love it. As a matter of fact, I bought two more for my girls because the price went way down on Black Friday deals. All three of us have the same phone in different colors. For the price, its exactly what you need in a phone. It has a lot of space, the camera is great and the finger print feature is awesome. The only problem is the ads that always pop up and I can't seem to get rid of them. Disturbing!! Other than that, better than any $1000 dollar phone.
customer_reviews.author: NITZA

customer_reviews.title: I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a happy camper. I've had this about a month now. Bought after I-6+ began having screen problems. Thought this would be a temp until i-10 became available. Cancel that, I'm loving this Honor 6X. Real 2 day battery life. Android 7 working flawlessly. Finger print lock works every time. I have no cons. Photo fine, sound fine, touch screen fine. Good job Huawei!
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone for the price ($200 at the time on amazon when I bought it). I switched to this as my old phone (LG G4) suffered from the notorious boot loop and this phone performs better than it in almost every way in my opinion despite what I read online. A great new phone to choose if you are looking to get away from the increasing price of the flagship phones.
customer_reviews.author: Val A.

customer_reviews.title: brick
customer_reviews.text: great little phone but bricked after 6 months, thought I'd be able to get it replaced under the warranty but got it back today with a note that said it had water damage and warranty was void...no liquids have ever gotten near my phone, and my issue was software related - not hardware. very dissapointed to say the least
customer_reviews.author: Matt Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: This phone has a ton of features for a 'budget' price: dual cameras, fingerprint reader, good quality screen. Camera is fast and responsive, excellent images. Apps load quickly, no lag detected. It has plenty of built in apps, but these can be easily removed. There's dual sim slots, plenty of built in storage, plus a micro SD slot up to 2TB extra storage. Very happy with the purchase, this is a fantastic value device!
customer_reviews.author: scott wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Midrange Phone Disguising As A Flagship
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Premium materials and design, fast fingerprint sensor, surprisingly snappy performance, dual lens camera, bright and vibrant screen, good call quality, amazing battery life! Cons: major OS woes, no NFC (no Android pay) Single speaker is a bit soft, no wireless charging, micro USB, no OIS for videos (shaky can galore), accessories are flimsy. Verdict: The best mid range phone of 2017 so far despite it's design weaknesses. I bought this to replace a OnePlus One which has stopped receiving OS updates. Here's hoping that Huawei follow up on their promises of a Nougat/EMUI update.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Unlocked Phone for T-Mobile Network
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play with T-Mobile. I used the 5x version and this one has much better battery life. The picture quality is about the same though I will say that I took the 5x to Europe last year and took excellent pics. You can either choose to pay less than $200.00 for a high quality phone or hundreds of dollars for a phone that does the same as this one. Huawei is unknown in the US but I saw plenty of advertisements in Europe which if you have never been there, the small stores usually only offer name brand or higher quality than in American stores. Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: tejanoman

customer_reviews.title: decepcionado
customer_reviews.text: I think they promise more than what the expectations cover, apart from I'm scared because the first day checking the phone, I put a YouTube video and the phone stayed dead, the screen went dark, did not answer and just blinked, not what I recommend, apart Because the Antenna receiving Wi-Fi connection has to be damaged, the connection is unstable, at every moment it falls, I am disappointed with the product and also annoying :( :( :(
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: It's keeping me happy for now
customer_reviews.text: Purchased May 2018. For a phone that's over a year old, new, I like it. I did a replacement of one because the original had some random lense floater affecting pictures. Love the phone so far. I'm getting the latest security patches. I've read online reviews from multiple sites about spending $20 more for the 7x. But if you ask me the 6x is on my limit for width of the phone...I couldn't go bigger. The camera is nice, some fun tricks, but not as nice as the camera on my wife's older Nexus 5x.
customer_reviews.author: christopher mee

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Amazing battery life!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the money...this phone is amazing! You won't find anything better for the price point. About a week into this phone and I love it! Baterry life -incredible! Dual rear cameras - focus after the photo is taken....is a really cool feature. Basic andoid platform - very minimal amount of bloatware added in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, only used it half a day but wow ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, only used it half a day but wow for $130 (there was a 20% off coupon) I am impressed. The screen looks really good, it's thin and a nice size. It's a little tiny bit slow when I'm using gesture typing quickly but still keeps up with it for the most part. I like the sleek look, looks like the top tier phones out right now. The battery life is amazing, I've been on it downloading and texting and setting things up for hours and used 6% battery so far. Pretty nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: No too bad
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about 3 months. I have always used the current android phones and paid well more than I wanted to so I did some research and purchased this Huawei phone. It's not a bad phone for the money and my bill is less than 1/2 prices than it was prior. I chose finances over quality and I'm ok with that. If this phone lasts a couple of years, I will buy it (newer version) again.
customer_reviews.author: jasigirl

customer_reviews.title: For the price this phone is amazing! Has a metal body
customer_reviews.text: For the price this phone is amazing! Has a metal body, screams quality, compared to my iPhone 6s Plus it’s really close on the outside. Screen is better than any low budget phone out there. No lag, great UI, camera is not the best but still takes great pictures. A+ Overall. Again compared to the iPhone I would still pick the iPhone but if I needed a budget phone it will meet and exceed expectations
customer_reviews.author: Jz

customer_reviews.title: lasts over a full day easily. DOES NOT GET HOT
customer_reviews.text: had it 1 month now and it already has blown me away. lasts over a full day easily. DOES NOT GET HOT. its fast and the OS is lovely. I was recommended this by some techhies at schoo and its the best $200 ever spent. love the wallpapers and customizations and the overall feel and function of it. i cam from samsungs and LG and the LG got hot and friend themselves. i am a HEAVY user and do 20gb per month and this has so far been amazing. I'll be sticking with the honor line for sure. get the spigen bumper case and ur good to go. it even has a light use screen protector installed!
customer_reviews.author: Brinton Evans

customer_reviews.title: This phone makes me feel like a sucker having spent so much more on other ...
customer_reviews.text: This phone makes me feel like a sucker having spent so much more on other phones in the past. I've been with Android since the G1. This might be my favorite Android phone thus far. I don't game but for everything else...it performs perfectly for me. LTE is solid. No echoing. Bluetooth hooks up fast. 64gb sd card works great Thumbprint is blazingly fast. Only thing I'm not to keen on is the audio chipset is pretty weaksauce. I use PowerAmp so the eq fixes mist of my issues regarding sound quality. That's subjective stuff though. Will by from Hauwei again.
customer_reviews.author: WASD

customer_reviews.title: Charging port fried
customer_reviews.text: After slightly less than a year of use, the charging port on the phone started smoking while plugged in, making the phone un-chargable and i am unable to access any of my data. Since it was less than a year, I went through the warranty process. They sent me a new charging cord, and I have not heard from them since. Since my phone is what is broken, that did nothing to fix the problem. TLDR The charging cord they provided with the original purchase fried the charging port on the phone, and they failed to honor the warranty and replace my phone.
customer_reviews.author: sonya warry

customer_reviews.title: CHOOSE THE BLACK!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal battery life, great camera during the day (gets fuzzy at night or in the dark), fast smooth processor, good graphics even with demanding games, nice screen, good brightness. My only gripes were the camera performance in low light (which is to be expected at this price point) and the colors on the IPS display looks a bit washed out compared to regular Amoled displays such as on Samsungs. Great phone overall. Btw I recommend choosing the version with the black front and grey back. It looks much better and premium than the other two. I think the white front version looks sort of cheap but that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Narine

customer_reviews.title: My worst purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: That was my worst purchase. It freezes so many times I lot count, typing a message can take a long time because the wrong words come up, the pages flashes many times send you right back to the original screen, a call can be cut without notice. Horrible!
customer_reviews.author: Youland Parris

customer_reviews.title: Was inexpensive, so bought two
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my wife an i, With both of us using the same model of phone, problems of useage could be ironed out quickly. Internal and external storage was great. However, now we're told by our carrier (My Family Mobile) that the phone won't work with VoLTE as of its implementation end of Jan '21. So, Sayonara!
customer_reviews.author: Spamcan

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I have ever purchased!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had too many phones to count. In the short time I have had this one, I can find nothing negative about it!!! It is fast, easy to use, takes fabulous pictures and looks stunning! When I find something lacking I will update. Extremely impressed!!
customer_reviews.author: Maiden504

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. As an avid iPhone user, I got tired of spending so much on iPhone upgrades. For less than $200, I got a phone the same size as an iPhone 6+. It is quick, bright, and the battery lasts a long time (so far). Small learning curve in getting all my customary apps in Android format. Overall, I will probably upgrade to another Huawei in the future.
customer_reviews.author: CVN

customer_reviews.title: iPhone 6 Convert
customer_reviews.text: Coming from an iPhone 5 and more recently an iPhone 6, this was not a transition I was looking forward to. Over the past 2 months I have been extremely impressed by the UI, battery life, responsiveness of the phone, and camera/photo quality. Not on the level of your $700 android or apple smartphones, but for the money I don't see how anyone could be disappointed with this device. Surprisingly awesome.
customer_reviews.author: David Conley

customer_reviews.title: I love my new phone
customer_reviews.text: I love my new phone. For this price, with all these built-in features, it can't be beat. I can voice dial. I can unlock quickly with my fingerprint. I can download and install apps just as any other pricier phone and they run just as smoothly. The storage space of 32 Gigs is more than decent, and you can insert a micro SD so what's not to like? Well... the picture quality isn't the BEST, but it's pretty good. Besides that, it comes with a lot of cool built-in picture editing tools and effects. Seriously, do yourself a favor and buy this phone if you are looking for a bargain phone with competitive features.
customer_reviews.author: Orrin Omali Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the value of this phone. I moved from a Google Nexus 5x to this and have been extremely happy with it. Only downsides I can think of are: No image stabilization, USB Micro Port, No 5ghz Wifi. I think for the value of this phone those are very forgivable sins. I've been using it as my daily phone for about a year now and have had no issues with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cell phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ex. I felt bad because he was using a crappy cell phone, always running out of space, lagging, so-so pictures, etc. Phone is fast, spacious, no lag and he takes excellent pictures. He even entered one of his pictures in a photography contest, won, and got it featured in the local paper. While I know when it comes to electronics sometimes you are unlucky, but this is an excellent phone. Solid performer. I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: L Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built design
customer_reviews.text: With all the positive reviews of this phone, I thought I would give it a shot. After using, I quickly realized that the shape of the phone began to bend like a banana. I have not done anything that I would consider strenuous, so the only thing I can attribute this defect to is it cheapness in construction. I reached out to Huawei and they told me to pretty much go pound sand. Because this is a physical defect, they said it is not covered under their warranty. Pretty ridiculous in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This phone is great, the camera is outstanding for the price, and it runs smoothly, the speakers are good and they can be very loud so that's good, works with VR to an extent, the gyroscope has slow reaction speed and shaking screen sometimes some vr apps work fine and some don't, this leads to a fun but annoying VR experience, I wouldn't put a whole lot of money into a VR headset for THIS phone, the fingerprint sensor is very speedy and fairly accurate as long as you configure it right, overall this is a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Root

customer_reviews.title: Works far better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works far better than expected. MUCH faster than my old 5x responding. The UI is smooth and responsive. Although I had to get a smaller sim card going from the 5 to the 6, it didn't take any time to do this. My MicroSD card works with it. The Camera is a big improvement over the 5x, much better quality. - After the update, the UI looks even better, and a new theme was added. I liked them both.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy. Buy. Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a half decent phone, but what I got blew me away. Dual Sim, great battery life, responsive screen and strong cameras with a wealth of features I had no idea I wanted until they were here. Bottom line? If you need a phone, you could spend a lot more and get a lot less.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Huawei two times and I'm back with Huawei with the Honor 6X and am very happy with this phone
customer_reviews.text: I've gone back and forth with Samsung, Huawei two times and I'm back with Huawei with the Honor 6X and am very happy with this phone. For the price you get pretty much a Samsung but without the Samsung price, actually think the Mates and Honor's might even be better? All in all we never really own a phone for more than a couple of years so why not try these fantastic Huawei phones.
customer_reviews.author: Jay O.

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like and have this product
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like and have this product...good battery life.......major issue is that it freezes and camera basically is super slow.......Really dropped idea to return it as I liked the phone...But I guess could not keep up with the sluggishness ..finally, returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Singh

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The phone works great without any lag issue and the battery does last quite a bit I bought this phone for my parents and they have not had a problem with it since then they especially like the fingerprint reader they had always had problems with cricket phones and Metro PCS phones so I decided to buy this phone which is a lot better quality than what service providers have to offer for the same price point $150 not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M. Cota

customer_reviews.title: Unfathomably Slow
customer_reviews.text: I was initially sold on the performance-to-price ratio. However, after owning for just over a year, the phone has become too slow to operate. If there is any instance in which more than one app is running, the phone will completely freeze up. Regarding signal quality, the phone doe NOT support 5ghz band wifi. ONLY 2.4. With that being said, I can usually get decent download speeds, but the moment I turn on my bluetooth, my speeds slow down to almost 0kb/s. There was a time when I would recommend this device. Now I wouldn't wish it upon my worst enemy. I feel very ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Phone is ok but OS need to be more robust
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone three month ago until right now.The spec is good and price is low. The camera is excellent. It looks like a good deal. However, there are the phone gets lag easily. To avoid lag, I need to reboot it every day. If it goes to sleep mode many times in a short period, the wifi hot spot lost connection easily. No one can connect through it. But it is back to normal after you turn it off and on again. The phone has all the good things. But the firmware and OS needs to be more robust.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Basically powerful
customer_reviews.text: Preliminary report, all is well. The phone operates smoothly and quickly as it should. The only complaint thus far is that it doesn't seem to have IR, meaning I can't use it as a universal remote for my TV. But, alas, nothing is perfect. For the price and performance otherwise, it's fantastic. More details to follow in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my 16yr old. He didn't like it at first, coming from an iPhone; especially with the finger sensor on the back. But he likes it now. He's thanked me a few times for surprising him with it so I do believe he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: texascutie

customer_reviews.title: VERY VERY IMPORTANT READ AND BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: This phone will not work on band 12 on TMobile which is the most important band for better coverage on t mobile. This is because huawei wont pay TMobile to certify this phone Big issue number 1. Big issue number 2 when you make a call the phone goes from lte to hspa and umts which TMobile is no longer building cell sites for. Big issue number 3 no wifi calling because it has unlocked software and no TMobile software can be flashed/loaded to it. Good phone it painful to see those 3 items not able to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: robert & anna

customer_reviews.title: It ran great for about two days but quickly slowed down
customer_reviews.text: Waited a couple of weeks in order to give it a decent test run before reviewing. The phone came with a cracked camera. The charger cord received with the phone looked used. The phone itself had scratches on the edges. The phone is a decent size. It ran great for about two days but quickly slowed down. The screen randomly goes black and freezes. Sometimes it closes pages on its own. I had high expectations and am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Harris

customer_reviews.title: I recommend to everyone!!!!👌👌👌👌👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: I like the back camera very much..I will give 5 stars to that alone. Then video clarity also very good...I will give 5 stars to that too.. Then selfie camera is good but sometimes it is showing full of too much bright like fully white balanced image. So I will give 4 rating to this. Then volume is bit not satisfied.. Because getting low volume since I have been purchased before 1.8 years. So I will give 4 stars to this Call quality also good i will give 5 to this too
customer_reviews.author: Pavithran

customer_reviews.title: AT&T Nano sim !!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone!! My son was very happy as this was his Christmas gift. We have AT&T and this phone works perfectly, all you need is the NANO sim card and your ready to go!! The phone itself works awesome its a good sturdy well made android, it's fast and just as good as my Samsung. For an off brand phone you won't be disappointed it does everything any android phone does. The camera is amazing! I must admit that's my son's favorite feature, it takes great pictures! Highly recommended buy!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa68

customer_reviews.title: Garbled voice
customer_reviews.text: I like(d) everything but the "phone" part of this phone. My voice is garbled for the person I call. Everything else worked fine, albeit a little slow, especially for the $150 I paid for it. The battery life was great. Update 2019: The phone is now quite slow, and the battery life is half what it was when new.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H. Reese

customer_reviews.title: speaker blew out after light use for 1 month, ...
customer_reviews.text: speaker blew out after light use for 1 month, speakers not maxed out (no damage, moisture, etc). hardware is good(minus camera,it is decent), software is OKAY. seems durable but I haven't been in the habit of dropping it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Hated this phone. It was slow, hard to use & took horrible pictures.
customer_reviews.author: martha bennett

customer_reviews.title: extreme camera lag
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 3 weeks now. fingerprint reader for the most part part is very responsive and helpful, esp, with EMUI gestures available. Screen seems fine for me, no ongoing issues with any lagging or nav. issues. I really want to love the phone and keep it, but it has extreme camera lag issues (opening camera, completing photo, processing photo, all very slow). I uybndersrtnad htis is an EMUI 5.0 bug. I do have latest Nougat and latest EMUI.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell B. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am loving this phone. Great size and great value. The camera is fantastic. I am a photographer amateur and to my surprise this phone takes very nice pictures. The image is sharp and colors are beautiful. If you add a photo editor app you can actually make great photos. The functions are easy and the reception is pretty good and quite fast. I am not a phone addict and I don't need a lot of apps but I would say that overal this phone has fantastic features for its price. This phone DO COME with flightlight.
customer_reviews.author: Isagreg

customer_reviews.title: Switched from Samsung phone definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of spending $800 on a phone that only lasted 2 years, so after doing tons of research I decided that this phone was the closest comparison to Samsung Galaxy phones. I've never been happier with a phone IN MY LIFE! It's super fast! Amazing screen size! Almost the same size as my Samsung Note 5. If you're hesitant getting out of the name brand phones, you won't be after using this phone! I used this with straight talk, which is an amazing service provider, had sprint before and never had service anywhere until I switched!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica O

customer_reviews.title: OMG WOW
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I bought this phone for my mom after her iPhone shattered. This phone is AMAZING. The screen is large, the swiping fast and smooth. Very intuitive user interface (I am an apple user and usually find myself stumbling around on Androids). The camera takes the best photos; it even has a "beauty mode" that even makes me look kinda cute (hard to do, I'm super unphotogenic). Honestly, think it blows iPhone out of the water; it's even faster. Might be saying goodbye to my iPhone and getting an Honor 6 for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, high quality for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: I can not get over show much I love this phone! I am on att, and after dealing with their switch from paying a couple hundred Max at contract renewal to paying about $500, having small amounts added to each bill which is absurd for then phone I had, I am over the moon to find such a quality phone for this price. The fact that I can put my SD card in it was a big plus for me as I know phones are phasing that ability out. It is easy to set up, easy to use and I plan on buying one for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Non existant 5G Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: Good overall phone with one giant negative. This phone will not connect to Wi-Fi 5g. This is a big deal as the 2.4 band is loaded and makes your internet slow and will not stream without buffering and in my router I have only 5g Wi-Fi so I can't Evan use my wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: For the Money, the best Cell Phone you can Buy
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is the best cell phone you can buy. Works seamlessly with the t-mobile network. l have owned one for 4 months and it has worked flawlessly with internet, data, phone, and all applications
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone for an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone for an awesome price. Going to buy the mate 9 later this year. I'm really impressed for only 150.00 I get more outta this phone than most others and major phone carriers. Plus it's not inked up with those ugly store logos on the back. Love it. I'll never buy a phone from a store again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good phone, however I had the Honor 5 and ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version and loved it. I bought this phone and it has been terrible, super slow and glitches out. It won't ring half of the time and then all of sudden I will have voicemails. Had to break down and purchase a new phone after only having this one for 3months. I did send a message to technical support and never got a response.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best buy for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought older model Samsung phones in the under $200 range. I travel a lot and am outdoors a lot, so my phones last only a few years tops. The battery life on this phone blows my mind! After leaving the house at 8am, I will still have 100% by 10am and then once I'm home and in bed around 10pm it has like 50%. It also charges super fast. The camera is also by far 10 times better than Samsungs that cost twice as much. We even have a Nikon professional camera that seems to not turn out as good as this little phone.. Pretty amazed and will prob only buy these from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't like to write reviews until I had time to use ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to write reviews until I had time to use the item. Now that I've had this phone for about a month now, I have to say this phone is great and is a lot of "smart phone" for the money. So far I really like everything about it. The camera takes nice quality pictures, the call reception is great and the volume is outstanding. One feature I am glad it has is the fringe print reader and it works perfectly every time. If you need an unlocked phone, you cannot go wrong with the Honor 6X.
customer_reviews.author: DMK

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Such a great phone for the price. I have used Huawei before in China but was worried how it would work here in Canada. Works great here and I use Fido, as its one of the only options here. The phone is fast and I have had 0 complications using it. The fingerprint reader works great as well. I would recommend this phone to anyone looking for a budget phone but still wants bells and whistles to it. Videos look great on here if you like to stream Youtube or Netflix. Only issue I have found is that it only has 1 speaker and it is hard to hear sometimes when doing a call on speaker phone or watching movies.
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah leech

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 9 year old. We have had it for about 2 months now. I can say that it holds up to constant use. The size is just right. She uses it mostly for games. I am surprised it is better than my Samsung Galaxy in terms of battery life. I am very happy with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Chitchat

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of junk phones and came across this phone. I don't like how it keeps changing "in" to "if" and "has" to "had". That is a minor annoyance. It holds a charge for 2 days. Calls are clear. I don't like how it says I don't have my data on when I clearly do. So besides those minor issues, I like the phone and the big screen it has. Picture quality is decent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome sauce

customer_reviews.title: It's a POS
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was buying used it was listed as excellent condition. That's clearly not the case with this phone. Bluetooth is an epic fail when pairing with anything except a headset, cell service is hit or miss where my wife's phone has no problems. The screen has a small "hot spot" obscuring the image or text below. Volume out the audio jack is never loud enough, even when cranked up to 11. And to top it off, a fall from a chair arm to a carpet cracked the screen. This may be a decent phone in general but something tells me the seller got this one out of the factory reject dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: dgrc

customer_reviews.title: Worth trying
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone...I know it is the Chinese version of other big name phone...but really has been working even better then expected.. Very much worth trying it..
customer_reviews.author: Aboualex

customer_reviews.title: Wow Yey phone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my daughter and she loves it. The device itself has a good build quality and so far performance is good. She is really enjoying. I also found that the Huawei software to be good and does not have a lot of junk apps and most of the apps that came with it can be un-installed. Phone has many features and camera is good for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: FTC

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how nice this phone is
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how nice this phone is! I thought one thousand reviews can't be wrong. I was right. The phone sets up easy. Is seemless. No bloatware that disrupts the simplicity and power of the phone. Bought it for 150 during black friday week. This phone is a darn good deal for 200 dollars. Must buy. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: khumalo

product_meta.title: Honor 6X Unlocked Smartphone, Dual Lens Camera and Dual SIM Standby, 3GB RAM, 32 GB ROM, Gray
product_meta.description: Color:GrayHonor has created a device that gives a double dose of what you would expect of a smart device. With the Honor 6x’s dual-lens 12MP + 2MP rear camera and ultra-fast focus time of 0.3 seconds you can capture colorful HD photos day or night. To double the camera capability, the Honor 6x also features a wide aperture range (F/0.95-F/16) that allows for a professional-grade shallow depth of field effect (blurred Background). the 6x's Octa-core processor(16nm) and 3GB RAM, in addition to its smart file system allows for seamlessly running Multiple apps at the same time. And last, but certainly not least, the battery delivers 2.15 days of usage. These features and many more culminate in double the performance of your average smart device. The Honor 6x, it’s double or nothing.
feature_bullets: The dual-lens 12MP Camera captures colorful HD photos day or night, with ultra-fast focus.
Android 7.0 Nougat + EMUI 5.0. Octa-Core processor(16nm) and 3GB RAM, Plus the smart file system allows for gaming, browsing, listening to music or running multiple apps at the same time.
Wide Aperture range (F/0.95-Back for/16) allows for a professional-grade shallow depth of field blurred background effect.
The Honor 6X battery delivers a delightful 2.15 days of usage, and 1.5 days of very heavy usage, on a full charge.
If two SIM cards are inserted, One SIM card at a time is set as 4G/3G/2G, the other slot will be set to only support 2G Networks.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,167 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
